Author: Alright#0419

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why does it need to have a block of a certain size?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just have it make blocks as it makes them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as long we we are getting multiple blocks per second, it will all get to all the nodes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: figured if we don't use full block size, we will be wasting bandwidth

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so 5 blocks with 1 tx each or 1 block with 5 txs

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 1 block with 5 txs will be less space

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: i agree on having a larger min block size... if the chain is going to either be under crazy data spam... or doing nothing

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: why have it mine only 1 tx per block?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: also with all notaries competing.. I dont know what will happen

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I disagree

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a block not filled doesnt waste bandwidth

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: assuming the next block can be created

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: by having such a restriction you will guarantee that the end of the stream will get stuck

Author: Alright#0419
Content: We aren't taking data from confirmed txs rather the mempool as they come in

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but it needs to confirm at some point to process it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: basically the block confirmation is the archiving of the stream

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: does it matter if you archive it in 100kb or 1MB chunks?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so why not do that in as less space as possible?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: less space?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: data is 99%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: block overhead is ignorable, that is why i ignore it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the fewer restrictions there are the fewer restrictions there are

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just because you are able to make consensus changes doesnt mean you should whenever you can

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like with the -dpowconfs, I could have done that via consensus change, but it was less impact to do is as a per node configuration

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: always make the smallest change that does the job

Author: Alright#0419
Content: No consensus change needed as far as I know

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: otherwise you are changing things more than you have to

Author: Alright#0419
Content: just stream data to mempool and let it confirm?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sure

Author: Alright#0419
Content: no need for fast blocks or anything like that

Author: Alright#0419
Content: or full blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no need for full blocks, but fast blocks are needed

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That depends how big the mepool can get befor eit crashes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 2MB/minute wont be enough bandwidth

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think fast blocks are needed

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if the mempool gets to 3GB

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the block level bandwidth needs to be more than the dapp usage of bandwidth

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and takes hours to empty ...
